dismay.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the worry, disappointment, or unhappiness you feel when something unpleasant happens
dismay.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The thought of leaving filled him with dismay.
They stared at each other in dismay.
I found to my dismay that I had left my notes behind.
dismay.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make someone feel worried, disappointed, and upset
dismay.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The poor election turnout dismayed politicians.
